channel.title: Azure AI Foundry Model Updates
channel.description: Latest updates on Azure AI Foundry models sold directly by Azure

item.title: gpt-5.2-codex
item.description: A GPT-5.2-series reasoning model optimized for coding workflows, including Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. It supports both Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) input, and advanced tool/function calling including parallel tool calls. Version: 2026-01-14; registration required; available in East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-5.2
item.description: A GPT-5.2-series reasoning model for general chat and agentic workloads with multimodal (text+image) input. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, structured outputs, and function/tool calling with parallel tool calls. Version: 2025-12-11; training data up to August 2025; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.2-chat
item.description: A GPT-5.2-series chat model offered in Preview for Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It supports structured outputs and tool/function calling (including parallel tool calls), but preview models are not recommended for production and may be auto-upgraded. Versions: 2025-12-11 (Preview) and 2026-02-10 (Preview); training data up to August 2025; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1
item.description: A GPT-5.1-series reasoning model supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and tool/function calling with parallel tool calls. It defaults reasoning_effort to none, so upgrades from earlier reasoning models may require explicitly setting reasoning_effort to enable reasoning. Version: 2025-11-13; training data up to September 30, 2024; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-chat
item.description: A GPT-5.1-series chat model in Preview with built-in reasoning capabilities. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, structured outputs, and tool/function calling, but does not support parameters like temperature (as a reasoning model). Version: 2025-11-13 (Preview); training data up to September 30, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex
item.description: A GPT-5.1-series Codex-optimized model for coding and agentic development workflows. It is Responses API only and supports structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and tool/function calling with parallel tool calls. Version: 2025-11-13; training data up to September 30, 2024; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex-mini
item.description: A GPT-5.1-series Codex-optimized model variant intended for coding workflows via the Responses API. It supports structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and tool/function calling with parallel tool calls. Version: 2025-11-13; training data up to September 30, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex-max
item.description: A GPT-5.1-series Codex-optimized model for higher-end reasoning/coding workloads via the Responses API. It adds support for reasoning_effort set to xhigh, and does not support reasoning_effort=none. Version: 2025-12-04; training data up to September 30, 2024; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5
item.description: A GPT-5-series reasoning model supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and tool/function calling including parallel tool calls. It targets broad reasoning and agentic use cases with a large context window. Version: 2025-08-07; training data up to September 30, 2024; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-mini
item.description: A smaller GPT-5-series reasoning model with the same core API surface (Chat Completions and Responses) and features like structured outputs, multimodal processing, and parallel tool calling. It is positioned for lower cost and higher throughput compared to the full model. Version: 2025-08-07; training data up to May 31, 2024; no registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-nano
item.description: The smallest GPT-5-series reasoning model variant, designed for efficiency while retaining structured outputs, multimodal processing, and tool/function calling with parallel tool calls. It supports both Chat Completions and Responses APIs. Version: 2025-08-07; training data up to May 31, 2024; no registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-chat
item.description: A GPT-5-series chat model offered in Preview that supports text/image input with text-only output via Chat Completions and Responses APIs. The 2025-10-03 preview version adds a significant enhancement focused on emotional intelligence and mental health response strategies. Versions: 2025-08-07 (Preview) and 2025-10-03 (Preview); registration not required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-codex
item.description: A GPT-5-series Codex-optimized model for coding workflows, intended for use with the Responses API only. It supports structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and tool/function calling including parallel tool calls, and is optimized for Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. Version: 2025-09-11 (also listed as 2025-09-15 in the global standard table); registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-5-pro
item.description: A GPT-5-series higher-end reasoning model available via the Responses API. It supports structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and functions/tools. Version: 2025-10-06; training data up to September 30, 2024; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-oss-120b
item.description: An open-weight reasoning model (Preview) for text-in/text-out workloads using the Chat Completions API. It supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs, and is available for deployment and via managed compute; unlike other Azure OpenAI models it requires a Foundry project to deploy. Version: Preview; training data up to May 31, 2024; available in all Azure OpenAI regions.

item.title: gpt-oss-20b
item.description: An open-weight reasoning model (Preview) for text-in/text-out workloads using the Chat Completions API. It supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs, and is available via managed compute and Foundry Local. Version: Preview; training data up to May 31, 2024; availability is via managed compute/Foundry Local rather than standard regional deployment.

item.title: gpt-4.1
item.description: A GPT-4.1-series multimodal model with text+image input and text output, supporting both Chat Completions and Responses APIs with streaming and function calling. It supports structured outputs in Chat Completions and offers a very large context window, but has a known issue where very large tool/function definitions can fail around 300k tokens. Version: 2025-04-14; training data up to May 31, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-4.1-mini
item.description: A smaller GPT-4.1-series multimodal model with text+image input and text output, supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs with streaming and function calling. It shares the same known issue as the 4.1 series regarding very large tool/function definitions. Version: 2025-04-14; training data up to May 31, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-4.1-nano
item.description: The smallest GPT-4.1-series multimodal model with text+image input and text output, supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs with streaming and function calling. It shares the same known issue as the 4.1 series regarding very large tool/function definitions. Version: 2025-04-14; training data up to May 31, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: computer-use-preview
item.description: An experimental model trained specifically for the Responses API computer use tool, enabling mouse/keyboard control with screenshot context via third-party libraries. It supports tools and streaming with text input/output and image input. Version: 2025-03-11 (Preview); training data up to October 2023; registration required; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: codex-mini
item.description: An o-series model that is a fine-tuned version of o4-mini, optimized for coding-style reasoning and tool use. It supports the Responses API with structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and functions/tools. Version: 2025-05-16; training data up to May 31, 2024; available in East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: o3-pro
item.description: An advanced o-series reasoning model focused on problem solving with increased capability. It supports the Responses API with structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and functions/tools. Version: 2025-06-10; training data up to May 31, 2024; available in East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: o4-mini
item.description: A newer o-series reasoning model offering enhanced reasoning abilities for science, coding, and math tasks. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal processing, and functions/tools. Version: 2025-04-16; training data up to May 31, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: o3
item.description: A newer o-series reasoning model with enhanced reasoning abilities and support for parallel tool calling. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs and multimodal (text+image) processing. Version: 2025-04-16; training data up to May 31, 2024; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: o3-mini
item.description: A smaller o-series reasoning model focused on enhanced reasoning with structured outputs and tool/function support, but text-only processing. It is positioned as a more efficient reasoning option within the o-series lineup. Version: 2025-01-31; training data up to October 2023; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: o1
item.description: An o-series reasoning model with enhanced reasoning abilities, structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and tool/function support. It targets advanced problem-solving tasks where additional reasoning time is beneficial. Version: 2024-12-17; training data up to October 2023; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: o1-preview
item.description: An older preview version in the o1 series. It is available only for customers who were granted access as part of the original limited access release. Version: 2024-09-12 (Preview); training data up to October 2023; availability is restricted to previously approved customers (see models table).

item.title: o1-mini
item.description: A faster and more cost-efficient o1-series model, described as ideal for coding tasks that require speed and lower resource consumption. Global Standard deployment is available by default, while Standard (regional) deployments are limited to select customers from the o1-preview limited access release. Version: 2024-09-12; training data up to October 2023; availability varies by deployment type and customer access.

item.title: gpt-4o
item.description: A multimodal GPT-4o (Omni) model that integrates text and images in a single model to improve responsiveness and accuracy in human-computer interaction. It supports structured outputs, JSON mode, and parallel function calling, with strong non-English and vision performance. Versions listed: 2024-05-13, 2024-08-06, 2024-11-20; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini
item.description: A smaller GPT-4o family model positioned as fast and inexpensive, ideal for replacing GPT-3.5 Turbo series models. It supports multimodal (text+image) processing, JSON mode, and parallel function calling. Version: 2024-07-18; training data up to October 2023; region availability is listed in the models table.

item.title: gpt-4 (turbo-2024-04-09)
item.description: GPT-4 Turbo with Vision, a generally available model used with the Chat Completions API. It replaces previous GPT-4 preview models (vision-preview, 1106-Preview, 0125-Preview), though feature availability can vary by input method and deployment type. Version: turbo-2024-04-09; training data up to December 2023; availability varies by deployment type/region (see models table).

item.title: text-embedding-3-large
item.description: The latest and most capable third-generation embeddings model for converting text into vectors for similarity and retrieval. It supports a dimensions parameter to reduce embedding size for cost/performance control, and migration from older embeddings requires regenerating embeddings. Version: not specified; output dimensions 3,072; training data up to Sep 2021; available via the Embeddings API (availability varies by deployment type/region in the models table).

item.title: text-embedding-3-small
item.description: A third-generation embeddings model for converting text into vectors, offering improved multilingual retrieval performance compared to older embeddings. It supports the dimensions parameter for reducing embedding size. Version: not specified; output dimensions 1,536; training data up to Sep 2021; available via the Embeddings API (availability varies by deployment type/region in the models table).

item.title: text-embedding-ada-002
item.description: A legacy embeddings model used to convert text into vectors for similarity and retrieval. The documentation notes you cannot upgrade between embeddings models; moving to text-embedding-3-large requires regenerating embeddings. Versions: version 1 and version 2; training data up to Sep 2021; available via the Embeddings API (availability varies by deployment type/region in the models table).

item.title: dall-e-3
item.description: An image generation model that creates original images from natural language prompts. It is generally available for use with REST APIs, while some SDK usage is in preview per the page. Version: 3.0 (as listed in the standard deployment table); available in East US, Australia East, and Sweden Central.

item.title: gpt-image-1
item.description: A GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview that generates images from text prompts (and supports image-related workflows per the series description). Access requires registration and eligibility approval. Version: 2025-04-15 (as listed in the global standard table); available in West US 3, East US 2, UAE North, Poland Central, and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-image-1-mini
item.description: A smaller GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview. Access requires registration and eligibility approval. Version: 2025-10-06 (as listed in the global standard table); available in West US 3, East US 2, UAE North, Poland Central, and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-image-1.5
item.description: A GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview. Access requires registration and eligibility approval. Version: 2025-12-16 (as listed in the global standard table); available in West US 3, East US 2, UAE North, Poland Central, and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: sora
item.description: A video generation model from OpenAI that can create realistic and imaginative video scenes from text instructions. The page states Sora is in preview. Version: 2025-05-02 (as listed in the global standard table); available in East US 2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: sora-2
item.description: A newer Sora video generation model variant listed as NEW on the page. It generates original video scenes from text instructions and is in preview per the Sora section. Version: 2025-10-06 (as listed in the global standard table); available in East US 2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-audio-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o family audio model (Preview) for audio and text generation. It supports large token limits and is part of the GPT-4o audio models that enable low-latency conversational interactions or audio generation. Version: 2024-12-17 (Preview); training data up to September 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-audio-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o family audio model (Preview) for audio and text generation. It is intended for conversational and generative audio scenarios within Azure OpenAI audio APIs. Version: 2024-12-17 (Preview); training data up to September 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-realtime-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o family audio model (Preview) for real-time audio processing. It supports low-latency audio interactions via realtime APIs. Versions: 2024-12-17 (Preview) and 2025-06-03 (Preview); training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-realtime-preview
item.description: A GPT-4o mini family audio model (Preview) for real-time audio processing. It is designed for low-latency speech scenarios via realtime APIs. Version: 2024-12-17 (Preview); training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-realtime
item.description: A generally available (GA) audio model for real-time audio processing. It is available via Azure OpenAI realtime/completions/audio APIs for low-latency interactions. Version: 2025-08-28 (GA); training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-realtime-mini
item.description: A smaller real-time audio model variant for low-latency audio processing. It is listed alongside gpt-realtime and supports real-time audio scenarios. Versions: 2025-10-06 and 2025-12-15; training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-realtime-mini-2025-12-15
item.description: A dated version of the gpt-realtime-mini model for real-time audio processing. It is listed as a specific version identifier in the audio models table. Version: 2025-12-15; training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-audio
item.description: An audio model listed for real-time audio processing within Azure OpenAI audio offerings. It is available via realtime/completions/audio APIs. Version: 2025-08-28; training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-audio-mini
item.description: A smaller audio model variant listed for real-time audio processing. It is intended for lower-latency or lower-cost audio scenarios compared to larger audio models. Versions: 2025-10-06 and 2025-12-15; training data up to October 2023; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: whisper
item.description: A general-purpose speech recognition model used for speech-to-text and also listed for speech translation. It accepts audio files up to 25 MB. Version: not specified; available via the /audio API (regional availability not detailed on this page beyond standard deployment table entries).

item.title: gpt-4o-transcribe
item.description: A speech-to-text model powered by GPT-4o, used via the /audio API. It supports audio files up to 25 MB. Version: 2025-03-20 (as listed in the global standard table); region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe
item.description: A speech-to-text model powered by GPT-4o mini, used via the /audio API. It supports audio files up to 25 MB. Version: listed in the global standard table as 2025-03-20 and 2025-12-15; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-transcribe-diarize
item.description: A speech-to-text model that includes diarization/automatic speech recognition features. It supports audio files up to 25 MB. Version: 2025-10-15 (as listed in the global standard table); region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe-2025-12-15
item.description: A versioned GPT-4o mini speech-to-text model with improved transcription accuracy and robustness. It supports audio files up to 25 MB. Version: 2025-12-15; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: tts
item.description: A text-to-speech model (Preview) optimized for speed. It is used via the /audio API for generating speech from text. Version: 001 (as listed in the standard deployment table); availability varies by region (see standard deployment table).

item.title: tts-hd
item.description: A text-to-speech model (Preview) optimized for quality. It is used via the /audio API for generating higher-quality speech from text. Version: 001 (as listed in the standard deployment table); availability varies by region (see standard deployment table).

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-tts
item.description: A text-to-speech model powered by GPT-4o mini (Preview) that allows guiding the voice to speak in a specific style or tone. It is used via the /audio API. Versions: 2025-03-20 and 2025-12-15 (as listed in the global standard table); region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-tts-2025-12-15
item.description: A versioned GPT-4o mini text-to-speech model (Preview) that supports style/tone guidance. It is used via the /audio API. Version: 2025-12-15; region availability is referenced via the models table.

item.title: o3-deep-research
item.description: A specialized o-series model variant intended for Deep Research scenarios. The page notes it is currently only available with Foundry Agent Service. Version: 2025-06-26; availability is restricted to Foundry Agent Service (not general deployment).

item.title: model-router
item.description: A Microsoft model that routes requests to underlying models to optimize for capability and context needs, supporting text and image input with variable max output tokens depending on the routed model. It provides a 200,000 token context window, but larger contexts only succeed when routed to compatible underlying models. Versions: 2025-11-18 (noted) with earlier versions 2025-08-07 and 2025-05-19 also available; available in Global Standard and Data Zone Standard in East US 2 and Sweden Central (billing for Data Zone Standard begins no earlier than Nov 1, 2025).

item.title: FLUX.2-pro
item.description: A Black Forest Labs image generation and editing model that accepts text and image prompts and can use up to 8 reference images via API. Key features include multi-reference support, more grounded real-world knowledge, greater output flexibility, and enhanced performance. Version: not specified; available via the BFL service provider API; Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: FLUX.1-Kontext-pro
item.description: A Black Forest Labs in-context image generation and editing model supporting character consistency and advanced editing. It can be used via Azure OpenAI Image API endpoints (images/generations and images/edits) and via the BFL provider API (preview api-version). Version: not specified; available Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: FLUX-1.1-pro
item.description: A Black Forest Labs text-to-image generation model emphasizing fast inference speed, strong prompt adherence, competitive pricing, and scalable generation. It is available via Azure OpenAI Image API (images/generations) and via the BFL provider API (preview api-version). Version: not specified; available Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-pro
item.description: A Cohere rerank/text-classification model for ranking documents given a query. It outputs JSON and supports multiple languages including English, French, Spanish, German, Japanese, and others. Version: v4.0-pro; available in Global Standard (all regions) and via managed compute.

item.title: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-fast
item.description: A faster Cohere rerank/text-classification model variant for ranking tasks. It outputs JSON and supports the same multilingual set as the pro variant. Version: v4.0-fast; available in Global Standard (all regions) and via managed compute.

item.title: Cohere-command-a
item.description: A Cohere chat-completion model optimized for reasoning, summarization, and question answering. It supports tool calling and can return text or JSON. Version: command-a; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: embed-v-4-0
item.description: A Cohere embeddings model that supports both text and image inputs and outputs vectors with selectable dimensions (256/512/1024/1536). It is designed for multilingual embedding use cases. Version: v-4-0; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.2-Speciale
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion reasoning model that returns reasoning content and is optimized for step-by-step reasoning tasks such as scientific reasoning and coding. It supports text and JSON outputs but does not support tool calling. Version: V3.2-Speciale; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.2
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion reasoning model that returns reasoning content for language and coding-style reasoning tasks. It supports text and JSON outputs and does not support tool calling. Version: V3.2; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.1
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion reasoning model that returns reasoning content and supports tool calling. It targets reasoning-heavy tasks including coding and scientific reasoning. Version: V3.1; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: DeepSeek-V3-0324
item.description: A DeepSeek chat-completion model variant (dated 0324) that supports tool calling and returns text or JSON. It is positioned within the DeepSeek family for strong reasoning and coding tasks. Version: V3-0324; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Global Provisioned (all regions).

item.title: DeepSeek-R1
item.description: A DeepSeek reasoning model that returns reasoning content and targets step-by-step reasoning tasks. It outputs text and does not support tool calling. Version: R1; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Global Provisioned (all regions).

item.title: DeepSeek-R1-0528
item.description: A dated DeepSeek R1 reasoning model variant (0528) that returns reasoning content for complex reasoning tasks. It outputs text and does not support tool calling. Version: R1-0528; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Global Provisioned (all regions).

item.title: Llama-4-Maverick-17B-128E-Instruct-FP8
item.description: A Meta Llama multimodal chat-completion model supporting text and image inputs with very large context and output limits. It is designed for multilingual enterprise chat scenarios. Version: not specified; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct
item.description: A Meta Llama chat-completion model for instruction-following text generation with a large context window. It supports multiple languages and is positioned as a mid-to-large scale LLM option. Version: 3.3-70B-Instruct; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: MAI-DS-R1
item.description: A Microsoft reasoning chat-completion model that returns reasoning content and targets complex reasoning tasks. It outputs text and does not support tool calling. Version: not specified; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: mistral-document-ai-2512
item.description: A Mistral Image-to-Text model for extracting text from images or PDF pages (up to 30 pages / 30MB). It returns text/JSON/Markdown and is intended for document understanding workflows. Version: 2512; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US and EU).

item.title: mistral-document-ai-2505
item.description: A Mistral Image-to-Text model for document extraction from images or PDFs (up to 30 pages / 30MB). It returns text/JSON/Markdown for document AI scenarios. Version: 2505; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US and EU).

item.title: Mistral-Large-3
item.description: A Mistral chat-completion model supporting text and image input with tool calling and text/JSON responses. It targets multilingual chat and agentic use cases. Version: Large-3; available in Global Standard (West US 3).

item.title: Kimi-K2.5
item.description: A Moonshot AI multimodal reasoning model that accepts text and image input and returns reasoning content. It supports tool calling and is positioned for high-capability reasoning workloads. Version: K2.5; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: Kimi-K2-Thinking
item.description: A Moonshot AI reasoning model described as the latest and most capable version of an open-source thinking model. It returns reasoning content, supports tool calling, and is designed for deep reasoning tasks. Version: K2-Thinking; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: grok-4
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model designed for enterprise use cases such as extraction, coding, summarization, and agentic applications. It supports tool calling and text responses. Version: grok-4; registration required; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: grok-4-fast-reasoning
item.description: An xAI Grok model variant optimized for fast reasoning with text+image input and large outputs. It supports tool calling and is intended for agentic and reasoning-heavy enterprise scenarios. Version: grok-4-fast-reasoning; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-4-fast-non-reasoning
item.description: An xAI Grok model variant optimized for fast non-reasoning workloads with text+image input and large outputs. It supports tool calling for agentic applications where explicit reasoning content is not the focus. Version: grok-4-fast-non-reasoning; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-code-fast-1
item.description: An xAI Grok model optimized for coding use cases with large input context and tool calling support. It is intended for enterprise coding and agentic development workflows. Version: grok-code-fast-1; registration required; available in Global Standard (all regions).

item.title: grok-3
item.description: An xAI Grok chat-completion model supporting tool calling and large context/output sizes. It targets enterprise tasks such as extraction, summarization, and agentic applications. Version: grok-3; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-3-mini
item.description: A smaller xAI Grok model variant supporting tool calling with large context/output sizes. It is positioned for enterprise agentic applications with potentially lower cost or higher throughput than larger Grok variants. Version: grok-3-mini; available in Global Standard (all regions) and Data Zone Standard (US).
